snippet: Barred from Hungary, sent packing from Serbia and unable to enter Slovenia, many are finding themselves boxed in.
abstract: Thousands of migrants are stuck in Balkans as Hungary and other countries raise barriers to block their entry; region is not prepared to handle large numbers of migrants, and their presence could inflame lingering sectarian tensions in Croatia and Serbia.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Joseph Orovic from Beli Manastir, Croatia; Matthew Brunwasser from Sid, Serbia; Kristina Bozic and Barbara Surk from Ljubljana, Slovenia; Palko Karasz from Budapest; Aleksandar Dimishkovski from Skopje, Macedonia; Boryana Dzhambazova from Edirne, Turkey; and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Barred from Hungary, sent packing from Serbia and unable to enter Slovenia, many are finding themselves boxed in.

headline.main: 17,000 Migrants Stranded in Croatia by Border Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Migrants Are Stranded as Barriers Rise Around Them

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
